page.title: 11FARMING (ii)
page.content: Sheep farming is usually combined with beef but Lincombe farms sheep alone. There are 150 Scotch Blackface at Shapley, 40 Dartmoors at Batworthy; at other farms e.g. Langaford, where there are 250 sheep, there are mixed breeds. Suffolk Cross are bred for meat, Close Wools are for pure breeding. Annual grass sales are a feature of agricultural life. Pasture is sold April _ October. Some winter grazing in the kinder climate of S.Devon is rented. Hay baling, silage making and hedge cutting are now contracted out to cut capital cost, as is sheep dipping (one tractor costs #13,000). Hedge cutting by flail now replaces traditional methods such as "cut and lay". Bee keepers, as at Brock Park suffer because of damage to flowering shoots. Silage is now used more than hay for winter feed.
